I'm fairly new to Junit, and am using it with Eclipse (on Windows XP).
I'm =
having problems running a simple JUnit test case. I have tried
searching Go=
ogle and the Eclipse/Junit forums about the problem, but I
haven't found an=
ything that helps. The code and failure trace are
copied at the end of this=
 message.

The error occurs in setUp(), when the Network object is instanti=
ated.
I can't understand why I'm getting the NoClassDefFoundError, because
=
the NetworkTest class is in the same directory as the Network class.
The Ne=
twork constructor doesn't throw any exceptions, and Network
doesn't have an=
y static fields.

Does anyone have an idea about what is wrong with the cod=
e?

I have tried adding junit.jar and my source files to the Classpath
(Con=
trol Panel -> System -> Advanced -> Environment variables), but it
didn't f=
ix the problem. 
I tried commenting out setUp() and the body of testGetName=
(), in which
case the test passes, so problem appears not to be with Junit =
itself.

Thanks in advance for any help.
